intro: Adesmia elongata, commonly known as the slender legume, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its distinctive pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. Its seeds are enclosed in long, slender pods that open to release the seeds. Adesmia elongata is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
